direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods modify the map by adding or removing key-value pairs, and involve similar synchronization and node manipulation logic.
Both methods involve checking the presence of a key in the map and use similar synchronization and node traversal logic.
Both methods involve iterating over the buckets and performing operations that affect the entire map, with similar synchronization mechanisms.
Both methods involve recursive synchronization over the buckets, although they serve different purposes (modification vs. atomic operation execution).
Both methods involve retrieving or modifying data based on a key, with similar synchronization and node traversal logic.
